Chapter 1 Pre-PreFresher Exercises 1.1 Linear Algebra 1.2 Operations Simplify the following \[\sum^3_{i = 1} i\] \[\sum^5_{k = 1}(3k + 7)\] \[\sum^3_{i= 1} 3k + i + 7\] Simplify the following \[4^2\] \[4^2 2^3\] \[\log_{10}100\] \[\log_{2}4\] \[\log e\], where \(\log\) is the natural log (alsowritten as \(\ln\)) – a log with base \(e\), and \(e\) is Euler’s constant \[e^a e^b e^c\] where \(a, b, c\) are each constants \[\log 0\] \[e^0\] \[e^1\] 10.\[\log e^2\] 1.3 Limits Find the limit of the following. \[\lim_{x \to 2} (x - 1)\] \[\lim_{x \to 2} \frac{(x - 2) (x - 1)}{(x - 2)}\] \[\lim_{x \to 2}\frac{x^2 - 3x + 2}{x- 2}\] 1.4 Calculus For each of the following functions \(f(x)\), find the derivative \(f'(x)\) or \(\frac{d}{dx}f(x)\) \[f(x)=c\] \[f(x)=x\] \[f(x)=x^2\] \[f(x)=x^3\] \[f(x)=3x^2+2x^{1/3}\] \[f(x)=(x^3)(2x^4)\] 1.5 Probability
